page.title: 14NANCEALVERNE HOUSE
page.content: Nancealverne House, the rear of it dating back to the 18th.cent.,is built of granite with a Cornish slate roof. The house stands in its own grounds which are now used mainly for market gardening.The house has extensive views over"The Park"which is used for grazing cattle.Agricultural shows have been held there,and once even a circus. The inside of the house is hung with portraits of the ancestors of the present owner,Mr.J.Scobell Armstrong. Earlier generations of the family were either soldiers or in the Navy,like Lt.Armstrong,who served with{Nelson}at the Battle of Trafalgar.Much of the family's prosperity came from their tin mines,which they still own. Nancealverne is{not open}to the public,but can be clearly seen from the main Penzance to Heamoor road. H.
